tutorialBasic-p-1: Please refer to How to Run for basic usage
tutorialBasic-aUp-p-1: Explain how to upload the original Agent to RRS-OACIS
tutorialBasic-aUp-create-p-1: For RRS-OACIS, you can use the agent that used RoboCupRescue Simulation Agent Development Framework (RCRS-ADF) as a prerequisite. Refer to the tutorial on RCRS-ADF and create Agent.
tutorialBasic-aUp-preparation-p-1: Once you have created the Agent, prepare an Agent Zip file with the following configuration
tutorialBasic-aUp-up-p-1: Upload Agent data used for simulation to RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-aUp-up-op-p-2-2: You can use alphanumeric characters and underscores in the name
tutorialBasic-aUp-up-op-p-3: Press the button to upload Agent data to RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-aUp-up-op-p-4: Upload completed when displayed as above.
tutorialBasic-aDr-p-1: Describes how to download the Agent uploaded to RRS-OACIS
tutorialBasic-aDr-move-p-3: Or you can move from the Agent screen by Link.
tutorialBasic-aA-p-1: Explain how to archive the uploaded agent.
tutorialBasic-aA-p-2: Archived Agent will no longer be displayed on simulation selection screen, etc.
tutorialBasic-aA-move-p-3: Or you can move from the Agent screen by Link.
tutorialBasic-aA-op-p-2: Archive is successful if the Archived item is True like the above image
tutorialBasic-aAL-p-1: Explain how to display the archived Agent
tutorialBasic-aAL-move-p-3: The data of the archived Agent like the image above is displayed in a list.
tutorialBasic-mUp-p-1: Explains how to upload the original Map to RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-mUp-preparation-p-1: Map data with the following specifications can be used with RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-mUp-up-p-1: Upload Map data used in simulation to RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-mUp-up-op-p-2-2: You can use alphanumeric characters and underscores for the name
tutorialBasic-mUp-up-op-p-3: Press the button to upload Map data to RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-mUp-up-op-p-4: Upload completed when displayed as above
tutorialBasic-mDr-p-1: Describes how to download Map uploaded to RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-mDr-move-p-3: You can move from the Map screen by Link.
tutorialBasic-mA-p-1: Explain how to archive the map uploaded to RRS-OACIS.
tutorialBasic-mA-p-2: The archived Map will no longer be displayed on the simulation selection screen, etc.
tutorialBasic-mA-move-p-3: You can move from the Map screen by Link.
tutorialBasic-mA-op-p-2: Archive is successful if Archived item is True like the above image
tutorialBasic-mAL-op-p-1: Explain how to display the archived Map
tutorialBasic-mAL-op-move-p-3: The data of the archived map is displayed in a list like the above image.
tutorialBasic-cAdd-p-1: Explain how to increase the number of clusters used in simulation.
tutorialBasic-cAdd-p-2: The OS assumes Ubuntu (I confirmed that it can be executed by the same operation on macOS.)
tutorialBasic-cAdd-me-li-4: Ubuntu's local account with password set
tutorialBasic-cAdd-setting-p-1: Enter the user name and IP address of the PC you want to cluster, in the format "user name @ IP address".
tutorialBasic-cAdd-setting-p-2-1: Sets the saving format of the simulation log file Select the format supported by the cluster OS
tutorialBasic-cAdd-setting-p-2-2: * Ubuntu is the default gzip format and there is no problem.
tutorialBasic-cAdd-setting-p-4: Add by pressing the Add button.
tutorialBasic-cAdd-setting-p-5: Setting is completed when displayed as above.
tutorialBasic-cAdd-setting-tips: It is also possible to build one cluster with only 1 to 3, there is no need to prepare 4 sets.
